intro: Cistanthe tweedyi, commonly known as Tweedy's cistanthe, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species.
